conclusion: Analyzing tension in a rope system with objects at rest
Solve problem step by step to find tension in ropes OP, OA, and OB
Object A has mass mA = 5 kg, Object B has mass mB = 10 kg, both objects are at rest, OB is horizontal, OP makes 45° with vertical, g = 10 m/s²
Since system is in static equilibrium, sum of forces at each point must be zero
Identify forces at point O: Tension in ropes OA, OB, and OP
Establish x-y coordinate system: +x right, +y upward
Find components of tension in rope OP: x-component = FToP·(1/√2), y-component = FToP·(1/√2)
Find components of tension in rope OA: x-component = 0, y-component = -FToA
Find components of tension in rope OB: x-component = -FToB, y-component = 0
Apply force equilibrium at point O for x-direction: FToP·(1/√2) = FToB, FToB = FToP/√2
Apply force equilibrium at point O for y-direction: FToP·(1/√2) = FToA, FToA = FToP/√2
Calculate weight-related tension for rope OA: FToA = mA·g = 50 N
Tension in rope OB must support weight of object B, but weight acts downward while rope applies horizontal force
Solve for all tensions: FToA = 50 N, FToA = FToP/√2, FToP = 50·√2 = 70.7 N
Final Answer: Tension in rope OP = 70.7 N, Tension in rope OA = 50 N, Tension in rope OB = 50 N
